page.title: 13MANOR FARM,BARNSTON
page.content: This farm was built in 1849.The farm is approximately{82 acres,}spreading as far as Dale Meadow,Crewn Croft and Railway Field in the north and to Whitehouse Lane fields in the south. Back Field and Lodge Field are near to the farmhouse. This is a{dairy farm}with a herd of 124 British Fresians;80 milking cows, 2 bulls,42 calves and calving cows. In{summer}the cows graze in fields and return to the new milking parlour twice daily. In{winter}they are housed in a large barn. The{new milking parlour}was necessary because of mastitis in the cows and the size of herd was limited until the building was complete.New E.E.C.regulations then prohibited restoration of the herd to its former size,thus making paying off the bank loan for the parlour very difficult.
